intro: Calochortus excavatus, commonly known as the desert mariposa lily, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northwestern Mexico. It is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink and yellow. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and arid environments, showcasing its adaptation to drought conditions. Its leaves are narrow and linear, often forming a basal rosette. Calochortus excavatus is a member of the Liliaceae family and is valued for its ornamental beauty and ecological importance in its native habitat.
